description: This data table provides the basic information for California child support cases, such as number of cases per county, the number of cases where the child is currently receiving public assistance, number of cases where the child formerly received public assistance (but no longer does), and the number of cases where the child has never received public assistance.  The data is sorted by county and broken into the Current Public Assistance, Former Public Assistance and Never Assisted types, the table will also show the percentage of that county’s total caseload.
name: department-of-child-support-services-case-overview-ffy-2015-ffy-2021

resources.description: This data table provides the basic information for California child support cases, such as number of cases per county, the number of cases where the child is currently receiving public assistance, number of cases where the child formerly received public assistance (but no longer does), and the number of cases where the child has never received public assistance.  The data is sorted by county and broken into the Current Public Assistance, Former Public Assistance and Never Assisted types, the table will also show the percentage of that county’s total caseload.
resources.name: department-of-child-support-services-case-overview-ffy-2015-ffy-2021-csv

fields.description:
Current Public Assistance: The number of open child support cases where a child is currently receiving public assistance. The percentage of cases in each assistance category is calculated by dividing the number of cases in each assistance category by the total number of cases for each individual county.
Former Public Assistance: The number of open child support cases where the child formerly received public assistance. The percentage of cases in each assistance category is calculated by dividing the number of cases in each assistance category by the total number of cases for each individual county.
Never Assisted: The number of open child support cases where the child has never received public assistance. The percentage of cases in each assistance category is calculated by dividing the number of cases in each assistance category by the total number of cases for each individual county.
Total: Number of open child support cases in each county.  Data Source is the California Child Support Enforcement (CSE) System.
fields.name: Case Type
fields.title: Case Type

fields.description: Total number of open child support cases in each county, as well as the total number of current public assistant cases, former public assistance, and never assisted cases by county. Data Source is the California Child Support Enforcement (CSE) System.
fields.name: Cases
fields.title: Cases

fields.description: The percentage of the total caseload for each county.
fields.name: Percentage
fields.title: Percentage
